metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5292 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Memory leak in the Privilege Attribute Certificate (PAC) responder plugin (sssd_pac_plugin.so) in System Security Services Daemon (SSSD) 1.10 before 1.13.1 allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a large number of logins that trigger parsing of PAC blobs during Kerberos authentication.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5292` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libipa-hbac0 - 1.13.1-2
libnss-sss - 1.13.1-2
libpam-sss - 1.13.1-2
libsss-certmap0 - 1.13.1-2
libsss-idmap0 - 1.13.1-2
libsss-nss-idmap0 - 1.13.1-2
libsss-simpleifp0 - 1.13.1-2
libsss-sudo - 1.13.1-2
libwbclient-sssd - 1.13.1-2
python-libipa-hbac - 1.13.1-2
python-libsss-nss-idmap - 1.13.1-2
python-sss - 1.13.1-2
python3-libipa-hbac - 1.13.1-2
python3-libsss-nss-idmap - 1.13.1-2
python3-sss - 1.13.1-2
sssd - 1.13.1-2
sssd-ad - 1.13.1-2
sssd-ad-common - 1.13.1-2
sssd-common - 1.13.1-2
sssd-dbus - 1.13.1-2
sssd-ipa - 1.13.1-2
sssd-kcm - 1.13.1-2
sssd-krb5 - 1.13.1-2
sssd-krb5-common - 1.13.1-2
sssd-ldap - 1.13.1-2
sssd-proxy - 1.13.1-2
sssd-tools - 1.13.1-2
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> according to debian, the responder part is not built, so might not be affected

criterions.comment: sssd package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.13.1-2').
